intro: Spermacoce pohliana, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spermacoce pohliana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
